title: Middle East Bank (Kenya)
text:
Middle East Bank Kenya (MEBK), is a <a href="commercial%20bank">commercial bank</a> in <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>. It is licensed by the <a href="Central%20Bank%20of%20Kenya">Central Bank of Kenya</a> (CBK), the <a href="central%20bank">central bank</a> and national banking regulator.
The bank is a small <a href="retail%20bank">retail bank</a>, that focuses on meeting the needs of large corporations and high-net-worth individuals. , the bank was ranked number 41, by assets, out of a total of 43 commercial banks in Kenya. , the bank's total assets were valued at about US$100 million (KES:11.02 billion), with shareholders' equity of approximately US$13 million (KES:1.124 billion).
History.
Middle East Bank Kenya Ltd started operations in <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a> in August 1981, after receiving a banking license from the <a href="Central%20Bank%20of%20Kenya">Central Bank of Kenya</a>, the national banking regulator. The initial shareholders in the bank were the <a href="Al-Futtaim%20Group">Al-Futtaim Group</a>, affiliated with the Middle East Bank Group of <a href="United%20Arab%20Emirates">United Arab Emirates</a>. In 1991, the Al-Futtaim Group divested from the bank, leaving shareholding in Kenyan hands.
In 1995, <a href="Banque%20Belgolaise">Banque Belgolaise</a>, a <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> financial institution acquired 25% shareholding in Middle East Bank Kenya, becoming the single largest shareholder. As a result of multiple bank mergers and acquisitions, that 25% shareholding subsequently came to be owned by <a href="BNP%20Paribas%20Fortis">BNP Paribas Fortis</a>. 75% shareholding remains in private Kenyan hands.
Ownership.
The shares of <a href="stock">stock</a> of Middle East Bank Kenya are privately held. The largest single shareholder, with 25% shareholding, is <a href="BNP%20Paribas%20Fortis">BNP Paribas Fortis</a>, a <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> financial services provider that is a <a href="subsidiary">subsidiary</a> of <a href="BNP%20Paribas">BNP Paribas</a>, a <a href="France">French</a> banking conglomerate that is the largest banking group in the world. Branch network.
, the bank maintains its headquarters in <a href="Nairobi">Nairobi</a>, Kenya's capital and largest city. It has three branches; two in Nairobi and another in <a href="Mombasa">Mombasa</a>, Kenya's second-largest city.
